intro: Randia longiloba, commonly known as the long-stemmed randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that are edible but not widely consumed. Randia longiloba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
